basics.name: Christopher Luna
basics.label: Software Engineer / Coder
basics.summary: Full stack engineer who simply loves coding. I enjoy being in a position to use tech to solve real world problems. #JuniorDevForLife

work.summary: Continue to lead development team and ensure collaboration with the wider engineering organization.
highlights: Lead the development of a new gene synthesis design and ordering portal for synthetic biology
Promoted to highest level for a technical staff within the company: started at level 2 as a new joiner
Tech Stack: See below

work.summary: Lead distributed development teams in Singapore and India and collaborate with R&D and engineering groups across Germany, USA and Mexico.
highlights: Accelerate scientific research using advancements in gene synthesis, genome editing and bioinformatics through the development of design and analysis software
Drive revenue conversion for oligo and gene synthesis businesses through better e-commerce tools
Responsible for developing the core of synthetic biology platform services through microservices and messaging and core UI components using microfrontends leveraging on CustomEvents
Develop a markup language based, DNA/Protein sequence and feature graphical viewer, used across the entire synthetic biology cloud products suite
Guide the team into the development of rule engines responsible for making product configuration decisions based on regional availability and manufacturability constraints
Tech Stack: AWS (ECS, Lambda, API Gateway, CloudFormation, SWF, S3, RDS, IAM, SNS, SQS), Docker on ECS, HTML5/Sass/Typescript, AngularJS/Redux, SVG / Canvas, Java/Groovy/Scala, Spring/Guice

work.summary: Architect bioinformatics solutions and tools and led the development of the company's molecular and synthetic biology visualization software and analysis tool suite.
highlights: Instrumental in delivering 8 products to the cloud platform, in a span of a year either in a core contributor or lead role
Develop distributed services for the next generation cloud based synthetic biology platform and tools leveraging on key AWS services
Build CI/CD pipelines for synthetic biology cloud products
Coordinate with distributed, cross-functional teams of scientists, product managers and development teams, managing product requirements and execution

Tech Stack: AWS (EC2, CloudFormation, SWF, S3, RDS, DynamoDB, ElastiCache, IAM, SNS, SQS), Docker on Apache Mesos/Marathon, HTML5/Sass/Javascript, AngularJS, SVG/Canvas, Java/Groovy, Spring/Guice, C++/Python for algorithms

work.summary: Lead the development of algorithms for multiple cloning technologies in synthetic biology
highlights: Develop new software modules and libraries used across the company's premiere bioinformatics tool suite
Re-engineer multiple sequence alignment software resulting in drastic improvements in performance and efficiency
Liaise and collaborate with scientists and postdoctoral researchers in the academe, finding ways to improve existing software product offerings
Tech Stack: AWS, Core Java, MySQL / HSQL / H2, Eclipse RCP

work.summary: Technical Lead for SMS notification platform and common service framework for public facing service portals built on Oracle middleware and database technologies
highlights: Tech Stack: Oracle Glassfish, JEE / Core Java, Oracle 11g/12c, Java Server Pages (JSP) with JQuery

work.summary: Software services startup with international clients. Part of an agile team responsible for building a highly concurrent, real-time dashboard for a financial system for high frequency trading based on Java technologies and frameworks, making heavy use of enterprise messaging
highlights: Tech Stack: Oracle Glassfish, JBoss HornetQ message broker, Java / Groovy, Spring, MySQL, Google Web Toolkit (GWT)

work.summary: Full stack developer for company's flagship SaaS for sales automation and inventory management for SMEs (Small-Medium Enterprises)
highlights: Startup environment where I am the core engineer responsible for the development of the application and backend architecture and management of GSM infrastructure
Delivered the pioneer releases of the product for customers, resulting in quicker turnaround for inventory and sales reporting for customers.
Built software on open-source technologies, hosted on a grid infrastructure (now known as cloud) and integrates with ERP systems (e.g. Netsuite)
Tech Stack: GoGrid (now part of Rackspace), Java, Spring, Google Web Toolkit (GWT), JGroups, MySQL, Apache Tomcat, Netsuite

work.summary: Started out as a layout engineer doing chip design. Eventually found my passion for software and developed layout automation tools for cell libraries
highlights: Tech Stack: C/C++, Perl, bash scripts on UNIX (Solaris SPARC)

skills.name: Frontend
keywords: SVG / Canvas / some WebGL on the side
